hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Asia: China: Tighter Controls On Police

abstract.p: Chinese officials plan to reduce power of police to detain migrant workers; move follows public outrage over death of Sun Zhigang, who was beaten to death in custody in March (S)

block.p: Chinese officials plan to reduce the far-reaching powers of the police to detain migrant workers, an apparent concession to public outrage over the death of Sun Zhigang, 27, a graphic artist beaten to death in custody in March. Legal scholars used the case to petition the government to overhaul the system of controlling China's floating population, numbering in the tens of millions. Under current rules, big-city police officers have broad leeway to apprehend, fine and expel outsiders who do not have temporary residential permits.
